Sentencas: In situ temperature-programmed (TP) analyses in a multi-analytical approach including X-ray diffractometry (XRD), temperature-programmed reduction (TPR), thermogravimetry (TGA), near-edge X-ray absorption fine structure spectroscopy (NEXAFS) are used to study the relationship between redox properties and structural changes in Pr0.5Ba0.5MnO3-delta (m-PBM), PrBaMn2O5+delta (r-PBM), and PrBaMn2O5+delta (o-PBM) when exposed to reduction/oxidation cycles.
Titulo: Insights into the Redox Behavior of Pr0.5Ba0.5MnO3-δ-Derived Perovskites for CO2 Valorization Technologies

Sentencas: TP-XRD analysis shows that under reducing conditions, between 300 and 850 degrees C, the biphase perovskite m-PBM turns into the monolayered perovskite r-PBM.
Titulo: Insights into the Redox Behavior of Pr0.5Ba0.5MnO3-δ-Derived Perovskites for CO2 Valorization Technologies

Sentencas: Stabilization of the latter phase at room temperature requires early oxidation in air at a high temperature (850 degrees C) to avoid segregation, resulting in the formation of the oxidized layered phase (o-PBM).
Titulo: Insights into the Redox Behavior of Pr0.5Ba0.5MnO3-δ-Derived Perovskites for CO2 Valorization Technologies

Sentencas: The o-PBM layered perovskite is characterized by the H-2-TPR profile, showing two reduction peaks at temperatures below 500 degrees C. TP-NEXAFS characterization reveals the copresence of Mn(IV) (60%), Mn(III) (30%), and Mn(II) (10%) and helps to interpret the reduction profile: Mn(IV) converts to Mn(III) at similar to 300 degrees C (I pk), Mn(III) to Mn(II) at similar to 450 degrees C (II pk).
Titulo: Insights into the Redox Behavior of Pr0.5Ba0.5MnO3-δ-Derived Perovskites for CO2 Valorization Technologies

Sentencas: The TGA characterization confirms the reversibility of the o-PBM <-> r-PBM process at 800 degrees C; in addition, it shows that the r-PBM can be oxidized almost completely (similar to 99%) also by CO2 without accumulation of carbonates.
Titulo: Insights into the Redox Behavior of Pr0.5Ba0.5MnO3-δ-Derived Perovskites for CO2 Valorization Technologies

Sentencas: This study sheds light on the peculiar redox behavior of PBM-based materials and paves the way for their application as oxygen carriers and catalytic promoters in different CO2 enhancement technologies.
Titulo: Insights into the Redox Behavior of Pr0.5Ba0.5MnO3-δ-Derived Perovskites for CO2 Valorization Technologies

Sentencas: Here, we discuss the results obtained to develop versatile and redox-resistant electrodes for solid oxide electrochemical cell/solid oxide fuel cell applications.
Titulo: Insights into the Redox Behavior of Pr0.5Ba0.5MnO3-δ-Derived Perovskites for CO2 Valorization Technologies
